info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 03 at 1:16PM PST until January 04 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow ongoing. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches with winds gusting 40 to 60 mph. * WHERE...Highway 97 including MacDoel and Dorris in Northeast Siskiyou County and Northwest Modoc County. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing and drifting snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Gusty winds are expected to begin about 12 to 18 hours before the snow begins. Snow is likely to begin between 4 and 10 AM PST Monday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
